AttributeList.Text: NB: the bit for each state stays high for one cycle after leaving the state. So when leaving State 2 for State 3, on the first cycle #StateChanges."2-zu-3_StateChange" will go high, setting the State 3 bit. But since the reset of State 2 is in an earlier network, this can't happen until the next cycle. So #StateChanges."2-zu-3_StateChange" has to stay high for the second cycle, when it causes State 2 RS to be reset. On the third cycle then also #StateChanges."2-zu-3_StateChange" is FALSE due to the State. This is subtle and tricky behaviour, not the best, rewrite this one day
The "missing" SET logic is here: Initialise (FB25) NW 2: "DB_StateMachine".State."0_Initialisation" := TRUE;
